lead_paragraph: A new earthquake hot line in California has been receiving calls from people who are jittery, gullible, information-starved or just plain weird. Some callers check in so often that the operators fondly refer to them as "quakies." The California Earthquake Safety Hotline opened in early August, five weeks after two major quakes on the same day killed a child, injured more than 400 people and caused damage of more than $92 million.

headline.main: 'Was That the Big One?': A Quake Hot Line
